com.google.gwt.gears.client.geolocation
Class Geolocation

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.geolocation.Geolocation

public final class Geolocation
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

The Geolocation API enables a web application to obtain a user's geographical position.

The Geolocation API enables a web application to:

  • Obtain the user's current position, using the getCurrentPosition method
  • Watch the user's position as it changes over time, using the watchPosition method
  • Quickly and cheaply obtain the user's last known position, using the getLastPosition() method

The Geolocation API provides the best estimate of the user's position using a number of sources (called location providers). These providers may be onboard (GPS for example) or server-based (a network location provider). The getCurrentPosition and watchPosition methods accept a parameter of type PositionOptions which lets you specify which location providers to use.

To find out how to implement your own network location provider for use with the Geolocation API, see the Geolocation API design document.

Permission

A site's permission to use location information is separate from the permission required by other Gears APIs. Permission is granted by the user in the same way as for other Gears APIs, through a dialog. If you would like to customize the default dialog, you can explicitly call the getPermission method.

Method Detail

clearWatch

public void clearWatch(int watchId)
Stop watching the current position.

Parameters:
watchId - the identifier of the watch to stop

getCurrentPosition

public void getCurrentPosition(PositionHandler handler)
Obtains a new position. A @{link PositionHandler.PositionEvent will be passed to the supplied handler when the operation completes. If successful, the event will contain the current Position. If none of the location providers find a good fix, a PositionError will describe the result.

Parameters:
handler - the handler which will receive a PositionHandler.PositionEvent when the operation completes.

getCurrentPosition

public void getCurrentPosition(PositionHandler handler,
                               PositionOptions options)
Obtains a new position. A @{link PositionHandler.PositionEvent will be passed to the supplied handler when the operation completes. If successful, the event will contain the current Position. If none of the location providers find a good fix, a PositionError will describe the result.

Parameters:
handler - the handler which will receive a PositionHandler.PositionEvent when the operation completes.
options - specifies the options to use for this request

getLastPosition

public Position getLastPosition()
Gets the last known position, or null if there is no last known position. This does not actively trigger obtaining a new position fix, so it is quick and does not consume power or computational resources.

Returns:
The last known position, or null if there is no last known position

getPermission

public boolean getPermission()
Lets a site manually trigger the Gears location security dialog.

It is always safe to call this function; it will return immediately if the site already has permission to access the user's location through Gears.

Returns:
true if the site has permission to access the user's location through Gears

getPermission

public boolean getPermission(java.lang.String siteName)
Lets a site manually trigger the Gears location security dialog.

It is always safe to call this function; it will return immediately if the site already has permission to access the user's location through Gears.

Parameters:
siteName - friendly name of the site requesting permission
Returns:
true if the site has permission to access the user's location through Gears

getPermission

public boolean getPermission(java.lang.String siteName,
                             java.lang.String imageUrl)
Lets a site manually trigger the Gears location security dialog.

It is always safe to call this function; it will return immediately if the site already has permission to access the user's location through Gears.

Parameters:
siteName - friendly name of the site requesting permission
imageUrl - URL of a .png file to display in the dialog
Returns:
true if the site has permission to access the user's location through Gears

getPermission

public boolean getPermission(java.lang.String siteName,
                             java.lang.String imageUrl,
                             java.lang.String extraMessage)
Lets a site manually trigger the Gears location security dialog.

It is always safe to call this function; it will return immediately if the site already has permission to access the user's location through Gears.

Parameters:
siteName - friendly name of the site requesting permission
imageUrl - URL of a .png file to display in the dialog
extraMessage - a site-specific text to display to users in the security dialog
Returns:
true if the site has permission to access the user's location through Gears

watchPosition

public int watchPosition(PositionHandler handler)
Repeatedly obtains a new position. If successful, a PositionHandler.PositionEvent will be supplied containing the current position as soon a fix is available and whenever the position changes significantly, subject to a maximum callback frequency. If there is a fatal error which would prevent a fix from ever being obtained a single PositionHandler.PositionEvent will be fired containing the PositionError describing the problem.

Parameters:
handler - a handler which will receive events when a position update is available, or if any errors prevent a position fix from ever being obtained by this watch.
Returns:
A unique watch identifier

watchPosition

public int watchPosition(PositionHandler handler,
                         PositionOptions options)
Repeatedly obtains a new position. If successful, a PositionHandler.PositionEvent will be supplied containing the current position as soon a fix is available and whenever the position changes significantly, subject to a maximum callback frequency. If there is a fatal error which would prevent a fix from ever being obtained a single PositionHandler.PositionEvent will be fired containing the PositionError describing the problem.

Parameters:
handler - a handler which will receive events when available and whenever the position changes significantly, or if any errors prevent a position fix from ever being obtained by this watch.
options - specifies the options to use for this request
Returns:
A unique watch identifier
